verses.verse: Hear <S%H8085><s%> you this <S%H2088><s%> word <S%H1697><s%> which <S%H834><s%> I take <S%H5375><s%> up against <S%H5921><s%> you, even a lamentation, <S%H7015><s%> O house <S%H1004><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

The virgin <S%H1330><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> is fallen; <S%H5307><s%> she shall no <S%H3808><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> rise: <S%H6965><s%> she is forsaken <S%H5203><s%> on her land; <S%H127><s%> there is none <S%H369><s%> to raise <S%H6965><s%> her up.

For thus <S%H3541><s%> said <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> GOD; <S%H3069><s%> The city <S%H5892><s%> that went <S%H3318><s%> out by a thousand <S%H505><s%> shall leave <S%H7604><s%> an hundred, <S%H3967><s%> and that which went <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> by an hundred <S%H3967><s%> shall leave <S%H7604><s%> ten, <S%H6235><s%> to the house <S%H1004><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>
For thus <S%H3541><s%> said <S%H559><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> to the house <S%H1004><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> Seek <S%H1875><s%> you me, and you shall live: <S%H2421><s%>

But seek <S%H1875><s%> not Bethel, <S%H1008><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> enter <S%H935><s%> into Gilgal, <S%H1537><s%> and pass <S%H5674><s%> not to Beersheba: <S%H884><s%> for Gilgal <S%H1537><s%> shall surely go into captivity, <S%H1540><s%> and Bethel <S%H1008><s%> shall come <S%H1961><s%> to nothing. <S%H205><s%>

Seek <S%H1875><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and you shall live; <S%H2421><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> he break <S%H6743><s%> out like fire <S%H784><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of Joseph, <S%H3130><s%> and devour <S%H398><s%> it, and there be none <S%H369><s%> to quench <S%H3518><s%> it in Bethel. <S%H1008><s%>
You who turn <S%H2015><s%> judgment <S%H4941><s%> to wormwood, <S%H3939><s%> and leave <S%H5117><s%> off righteousness <S%H6666><s%> in the earth, <S%H776><s%>

Seek him that makes <S%H6213><s%> the seven <S%H3598><s%> stars <S%H3598><s%> and Orion, <S%H3685><s%> and turns <S%H2015><s%> the shadow <S%H6757><s%> of death <S%H6757><s%> into the morning, <S%H1242><s%> and makes the day <S%H3117><s%> dark <S%H2821><s%> with night: <S%H3915><s%> that calls <S%H7121><s%> for the waters <S%H4325><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> and pours <S%H8210><s%> them out on the face <S%H6440><s%> of the earth: <S%H776><s%> The LORD <S%H3068><s%> is his name: <S%H8034><s%>

That strengthens <S%H1082><s%> the spoiled <S%H7701><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> the strong, <S%H5794><s%> so that the spoiled <S%H7701><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> the fortress. <S%H4013><s%>
They hate <S%H8130><s%> him that rebukes <S%H3198><s%> in the gate, <S%H8179><s%> and they abhor <S%H8581><s%> him that speaks <S%H1696><s%> uprightly. <S%H8549><s%>

For as much <S%H3282><s%> therefore <S%H3651><s%> as your treading <S%H1318><s%> is on the poor, <S%H1800><s%> and you take <S%H3947><s%> from him burdens <S%H4864><s%> of wheat: <S%H1250><s%> you have built <S%H1129><s%> houses <S%H1004><s%> of hewn <S%H1496><s%> stone, <S%H1496><s%> but you shall not dwell <S%H3427><s%> in them; you have planted <S%H5193><s%> pleasant <S%H2531><s%> vineyards, <S%H3754><s%> but you shall not drink <S%H8354><s%> wine <S%H3196><s%> of them.

For I know <S%H3045><s%> your manifold <S%H7227><s%> transgressions <S%H6588><s%>and your mighty <S%H6099><s%> sins: <S%H2403><s%> they afflict <S%H6887><s%> the just, <S%H6662><s%> they take <S%H3947><s%> a bribe, <S%H3724><s%> and they turn <S%H5186><s%> aside <S%H5186><s%> the poor <S%H34><s%> in the gate <S%H8179><s%> from their right.
Therefore <S%H3651><s%> the prudent <S%H7919><s%> shall keep silence <S%H1826><s%> in that time; <S%H6256><s%> for it is an evil <S%H7451><s%> time. <S%H6256><s%>

Seek <S%H1875><s%> good, <S%H2896><s%> and not evil, <S%H7451><s%> that you may live: <S%H2421><s%> and so <S%H3651><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> shall be with you, as you have spoken. <S%H559><s%>

Hate <S%H8130><s%> the evil, <S%H7451><s%> and love <S%H157><s%> the good, <S%H2896><s%> and establish <S%H3322><s%> judgment <S%H4941><s%> in the gate: <S%H8179><s%> it may be that the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> will be gracious <S%H2587><s%> to the remnant <S%H7611><s%> of Joseph. <S%H3130><s%>

Therefore <S%H3651><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> the LORD, <S%H136><s%> said <S%H559><s%> thus; <S%H3541><s%> Wailing <S%H4553><s%> shall be in all <S%H3605><s%> streets; <S%H7339><s%> and they shall say <S%H559><s%> in all <S%H3605><s%> the highways, <S%H2351><s%> Alas! <S%H1930><s%> alas! <S%H1930><s%> and they shall call <S%H7121><s%> the farmer <S%H406><s%> to mourning, <S%H60><s%> and such as are skillful <S%H3045><s%> of lamentation <S%H5092><s%> to wailing. <S%H4553><s%>
And in all <S%H3605><s%> vineyards <S%H3754><s%> shall be wailing: <S%H4553><s%> for I will pass <S%H5674><s%> through <S%H7130><s%> you, said <S%H559><s%> the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>

Woe <S%H1945><s%> to you that desire <S%H183><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> of the LORD! <S%H3068><s%> to what <S%H4100><s%> end is it for you? the day <S%H3117><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is darkness, <S%H2822><s%> and not light. <S%H216><s%>

As if <S%H834><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> did flee <S%H5127><s%> from a lion, <S%H738><s%> and a bear <S%H1677><s%> met <S%H6293><s%> him; or went <S%H935><s%> into the house, <S%H1004><s%> and leaned <S%H5564><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> on <S%H5921><s%> the wall, <S%H7023><s%> and a serpent <S%H5175><s%> bit <S%H5391><s%> him.

Shall not the day <S%H3117><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> be darkness, <S%H2822><s%> and not light? <S%H216><s%> even very <S%H651><s%> dark, <S%H651><s%> and no <S%H3808><s%> brightness <S%H5051><s%> in it?
I hate, <S%H8130><s%> I despise <S%H3988><s%> your feast <S%H2282><s%> days, and I will not smell <S%H7306><s%> in your solemn <S%H6116><s%> assemblies. <S%H6116><s%>

Though <S%H3588><s%> <S%H518><s%> you offer <S%H5927><s%> me burnt <S%H5930><s%> offerings <S%H4503><s%>and your meat offerings, I will not accept <S%H7521><s%> them: neither <S%H3808><s%> will I regard <S%H5027><s%> the peace <S%H8002><s%> offerings of your fat <S%H4806><s%> beasts. <S%H4806><s%>
Take <S%H5493><s%> you away <S%H5493><s%> from me the noise <S%H1995><s%> of your songs; <S%H7892><s%> for I will not hear <S%H8085><s%> the melody <S%H2172><s%> of your viols. <S%H5035><s%>
But let judgment <S%H4941><s%> run <S%H1556><s%> down as waters, <S%H4325><s%> and righteousness <S%H6666><s%> as a mighty <S%H386><s%> stream. <S%H5158><s%>

Have you offered <S%H5066><s%> to me sacrifices <S%H2077><s%> and offerings <S%H4503><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> forty <S%H705><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> O house <S%H1004><s%> of Israel? <S%H3478><s%>

But you have borne <S%H5375><s%> the tabernacle <S%H5522><s%> of your Moloch <S%H4432><s%> and Chiun <S%H3594><s%> your images, <S%H6754><s%> the star <S%H3556><s%> of your god, <S%H430><s%> which <S%H834><s%> you made <S%H6213><s%> to yourselves.

Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity <S%H1540><s%> beyond <S%H1973><s%> Damascus, <S%H1834><s%> said <S%H559><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> whose name <S%H8034><s%> is The God <S%H430><s%> of hosts. <S%H6635><s%>
